alert.note: Alert for Western Mogollon Rim (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 10 at 11:27AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of the Flagstaff Metro Area in Coconino County through NOON MST... At 1126 AM MST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms over Flagstaff, moving northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Localized flooding is possible. Locations impacted include... Flagstaff, Cosnino, Fort Valley, Flagstaff Mall, Walnut Canyon National Monument, Downtown Flagstaff, Hutchison Acres, Walnut Canyon Visitors Center, Little Elden Spring Horse Camp, Canyon Vista Campground and Lower Lake Mary. This includes the following highways... Route 66 between mile markers 192 and 204. Interstate 40 between mile markers 192 and 208. U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 419 and 423. Highway 180 between mile markers 217 and 224. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
